title: Registration Reviews widget - Permissions
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* The widget should have its own permission created for it. 
* Users without the permission should not see the widget on the L1 Reg tab. 
* Only users with international amateur profile editors permissions should see the "Update" button on the widget at all. 
* Add the new LDAP to test users 52 and 75. 
* This permission will be added to the ebis-intl-boc-regadmins and ebis-intl-boc-reganalysts roles.

title: Registration Reviews widget - Permissions
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* The widget should have its own permission created for it. 
* Users without the permission should not see the widget on the L1 Reg tab. 
* Only users with international amateur profile editors permissions should see the "Update" button on the widget at all. 
* Add the new LDAP to test users 52 and 75. 
* This permission will be added to the ebis-intl-boc-regadmins and ebis-intl-boc-reganalysts roles.

title: As a user I want to delete International Scouting Reports
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 

* Users that have permission to edit International Workout reports will see a Delete button on preliminary or rejected International Workout reports in view and edit mode 
* Clicking "Delete" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to delete the report.
* Confirming the delete will assign the  a deleted status and throw a blue notification "Successfully deleted"
* The item will no longer appears on any Clipboard, or in any search unless the user has specifically searched for Deleted profiles.

title: As a user I want to delete Daily Reports
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 

* Users that have permission to edit daily reports will see a Delete button on preliminary or rejected daily reports in view and edit mode 
* Clicking "Delete" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to delete the report.
* Confirming the delete will assign the  a deleted status and throw a blue notification "Successfully deleted"
* The item will no longer appears on any Clipboard, or in any search unless the user has specifically searched for Deleted profiles.

title: As a user, I want to open International Scouting reports from the Player History widget of a Professional Player
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 

* Users that have permission to view International Workout reports and daily reports should see these items appear in the Player History widget if the player has one
* Item in Player History Widget Info: Date: Report Date, Code: Scouting, Description : [The Report Type] 
* The description should be a hyperlink 
* Clicking on the hyperlink will open the report as expected

title: As a BOC user I only want to see current year for the All Registered Player Report only if I have permission to do so
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 

* A new LDAP needs to be created EBIS-RPT-ALLREGISTEREDPLAYERSADMIN
* When running the All Registered Player Report, BOC users with this LDAP will be able to see if current year as an option regardless of what the Open All Registered System Date is set to
* BOC users without the EBIS-RPT-ALLREGISTEREDPLAYERSADMIN LDAP will not see the current year option in the All Registered Report dropdown until the Open All Registered System Date has passed

title: As a user I want the existing scout profiles converted to the new scout profile
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria:
* The existing scout profiles are converted so that they are visible in the Scout Directory widget just like newly created profiles.
* The data from the profiles is maintained and correctly displayed (except for those fields that we removed from the profile).

title: As a user I want the existing scout profiles converted to the new scout profile
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria:
* The existing scout profiles are converted so that they are visible in the Scout Directory widget just like newly created profiles.
* The data from the profiles is maintained and correctly displayed (except for those fields that we removed from the profile).

title: As a user I want to be able to stop and restart the automated picker without restarting the draft
custom_steps:
The draft picker should be able to be stopped (killing the process is acceptable)

The draft picker should be able to start from the current pick and begin making picks immediately

title: As a User I want to be able to start a draft load test
custom_steps: Using the draft picker tool as a base, I want a separate spring boot application which can be started up and will connect to the rule 4 draft (vertx) to listen for events.

title: As a User I want the draft load test to take an excel file to specify which connections should be made
custom_steps:
The draft load test should take in an excel file with the columns listed below.  For each row in the sheet, it should create <client count> connections to the draft.
Org, User name, password, client count

title: As a User, I want to be able to check logs for the draft picker tool and to see any errors that occur
custom_steps: The draft picker should have a log file which is easy to view/tail

title: As a User I want the draft load test to report results
custom_steps: As draft events are received the draft picker should log them, keeping track by client of each type of message.  Once the threads are completed, they should output their results

title: As a user I want the draft load test to also test draft feeds
custom_steps: The draft load test should also be configurable to create draft feeds.

title: As a User I want the Draft picker tool to be configurable to pick club entered players when it is making random picks
custom_steps: The draft picker should be configurable to include club entered players when making random selections (parameter)

title: As a User I want the draft picker tool to be able to draft a specific player with a specific pick
custom_steps: In addition to making random picks, the draft picker tool should be configurable to select a specific draft id with a specific overall pick (parameter)

title: As a User I want the draft picker tool to pass for specific picks
custom_steps:
The draft picker tool should be configurable to pass for selected picks (parameter)

It should allow for multiple passes

title: As a user I want the draft picker tool to handle  warnings associated with a consent required player
custom_steps: If the player selected for an org requires consent, the draft picker should handle the response, override the warning and re-submit/approve the player.

title: As a User I want the R5 draft picker tool to connect to the draft and make selections
custom_steps:
By default when the application starts up it should get the draft state and then begin submitting picks and then approving them every 5 seconds.

Selections should be made randomly from the list of players who are eligible and selectable.

If the draft is NOT started and is in a state which can be started, the application should start it.

If the draft is RUNNING the application should start making picks from the current pick

If the draft is in a state and cannot be started, an error should be thrown

title: As a User I want to be able to customize the time between picks for the R5 draft picker tool
custom_steps: The time between approved picks should be configurable (parameter).

title: As a user I want to be able to stop and restart the automated picker without restarting the R5 draft
custom_steps:
The draft picker should be able to be stopped (killing the process is acceptable)

The draft picker should be able to start from the current pick and begin making picks immediately

title: As a User I want the R5 draft picker tool to be able to draft a specific player with a specific pick
custom_steps: In addition to making random picks, the draft picker tool should be configurable to select a specific draft id with a specific overall pick (parameter)

title: As a User I want the R5 draft picker tool to pass for specific picks
custom_steps:
The draft picker tool should be configurable to pass for selected picks (parameter)

It should allow for multiple passes

title: As a User, I want to be able to check logs for the R5 draft picker tool and to see any errors that occur
custom_steps: The draft picker should have a log file which is easy to view/tail

title: As a Tester I want the R4 draft picker to take a parameter for whether or not to start the draft in mock mode
custom_steps:
The default should be to run the draft in actual mode however there should be a flag which can tell the draft to run in mock mode.

If the draft starts in regular mode, it also needs to kick off the database updater

title: As a Developer, I want to setup a spring boot application for the R5 Draft Picker tool
custom_steps:
Create a spring boot application and add the source to git

Application doesn't need to do anything yet other than start up.

title: As a User, I want to Remove Players from the Trade Contract Info Widget
custom_steps:
Wire:
https://t4lvuq.axshare.com/#p=trade_contract_info

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Trade+Contract+Info+widget

AC:
 - There will be a trash can icon in each row in the Trade Contract Info widget, as depicted in the wire
 - Clicking the icon will remove the row from the widget
 - There will be a Clear All button on the widget, as depicted in the wire
 - Clicking the Clear All button will prompt the user to confirm they wish to clear all players
- If they confirm the decision, all rows  will be cleared from the widget
- If they do not confirm the decision, the user will be returned to the form and no action will be taken.

title: As a User, I want to View the Trade Contract Info Widget
custom_steps:
Wire:
https://t4lvuq.axshare.com/#p=trade_contract_info

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Trade+Contract+Info+widget

AC:
 - BOC and Club Users with the appropriate permissions will see a Trade Contract Info widget on the "Player Tracking" tab of the Transactions Dashboard
 - The widget will appear under the Current DFA Players widget
 - The header of the widget will display the prorated MJ Minimum salary as of Today
 - The header of the widget will display the prorated MJ Minimum salary as of Tomorrow

title: As a User, I want to Add a Player to the Trade Contract Info Widget
custom_steps:
Wire:
https://t4lvuq.axshare.com/#p=trade_contract_info

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Trade+Contract+Info+widget

AC:
 - There will be an Add Row button on the Trade Contract Info widget, as depicted in the wire
 - Clicking the button will add a row to the bottom of the widget
 - If necessary, the widget will auto-scroll so the new row is in view
 - The widget will also auto-horizontal scroll so the Name field is in view and in focus.  
 - The player column will be the only editable column
 -  The Player column will be an auto-complete with a population of all players with a currently approved MJ Contract
 -  Selecting a player from the auto-complete will populate all the appropriate fields with the correct data points from the players profile

title: As a User, I want to view option information in the Trade Contract Info Widget
custom_steps:
Wire:
https://t4lvuq.axshare.com/#p=trade_contract_info

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Trade+Contract+Info+widget

AC:
 - The Option column will be hyper linked
 - Clicking on the link will open a modal that displays information on all of the options tied to the player's current MJC.  This information includes:
- Option Year
- Option Type
- Option Amount
- Buyout Amount

title: As a User, I want to view NTP Teams on Trade Contract Info Widget
custom_steps:
Wire:
https://t4lvuq.axshare.com/#p=trade_contract_info

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Trade+Contract+Info+widget

AC:
 - The No Trade Teams column will be hyper linked
 - Clicking on the link will open a modal that displays all of the teams listed in the player's Limited No Trade Provision

title: As a User, I want to view Assignment Bonus comments from the Trade Contract Info Widget
custom_steps:
Wire:
https://t4lvuq.axshare.com/#p=trade_contract_info

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Trade+Contract+Info+widget

AC:
 - Assignment Bonus amounts  will be hyper linked in the Trade Contract Info widget
 - Clicking on the link will open a modal that displays the language associated with the covenant on the Player's Assignment Clause on his current MJC

title: As a User, I want to view contract summary information from the Trade Contract Info Widget
custom_steps:
Wire:
https://t4lvuq.axshare.com/#p=trade_contract_info

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Trade+Contract+Info+widget

AC:
 - The Summary column will contain a comment bubble as depicted in the wire
 - Clicking on the bubble will open a modal that displays whether or not the contracts contains the following clauses:
- Salary Escalators
- Performance Bonuses
- Deferred Comp
- Misc Text
 - If the contract does not contain any of those clauses, there will not be a comment bubble in the column

title: Trade Contract Info widget permissions
custom_steps: EBIS-WIDGET-TRADE-CONTRACT-INFO-VIEWERS

title: As a User, I want to open a contract directly from the Trade Contract Info widget
custom_steps:
Wire:
https://t4lvuq.axshare.com/#p=trade_contract_info

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Trade+Contract+Info+widget

AC:
 - The Overall Salary Tom column should be a hyperlink
- Clicking the hyperlink will open the player's MJC in a new browser tab

title: As a User, I want fields added to the School Lookup in ebis link
custom_steps:
Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Club+Feed+Requirements%3A+Lookups

Acceptance Criteria: 
* The following fields will be added to the School Lookup in ebis link:
 - Province
 - District
 - Sector

title: As a user I want all old domestic amateur links to be updated to forward to the new profile
custom_steps:
The easiest way to ensure this is working correctly is to add in the same redirect we have for when we load a professional player and their person type is 6 to the old domestic profile controller.

Loading a player with the following URL: 
    domestic-amateur/domestic-amateur-info?domAmaEntryId=1087608&playerId=803660
should redirect you to: 
    dom-ama-player-profile/info?playerId=803660

title: As a user, I want Awards information returned through ebis link
custom_steps:
Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Club+Feed+Requirements%3A+Awards

Acceptance Criteria: 
 - Club user must be able to retrieve all award info for a given player ID
 - Club user must be able to retrieve all award info for a given year/award combination (e.g. all players who got votes for the 2017 Gold Glove Award)
 - Club user must be able to retrieve award info for all award entries modified/added within a given date range (either between two dates or from a given date through today)
 - Fields listed on the linked wiki should be added to the API
 - Fields NOT listed, or fields listed as specifically being excluded should not be added to the API
 - Data in the response must exactly match data on the UI for the award.
 - Response should be returned under 2 seconds
 - Only logged in users with an API role can access this information
 - There should also be an /all endpoint for awards

title: As a developer i want to be able to get Player ids that were updated (via a data fix) - dom
custom_steps: Update EBIS_LINK_PLAYER_VIEW view to include data fixes that get applied to a players domestic info.

title: As BAM R4 User, I want fields added to the Draft API
custom_steps:
AC:
 - The following fields should be added to the Rule 4 Draft API (Draft Players):
  -- Date of Birth
  -- Height (Feet)
  -- Height (Inches)
  -- Weight
  -- Birth Country
 - Remove the Eligible Players (public) feed

- update the documentation

title: As a club, I want information returned for the Awards Lookup
custom_steps:
Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Club+Feed+Requirements%3A+Awards

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Many of the other feeds (player profile, contracts, etc.) contain IDs/codes, so the feed users will need to be able to lookup those codes to find more information about what they stand for.  For example, Org ID 21 is NYY/New York Yankees.
* Club user must be able to retrieve lookup info for all records modified/added within a given date range
* Club user must be able to retrieve lookup info by passing in ID (e.g. Org ID, Club ID, etc.)
* Club user must be able to determine if any lookup records were physically deleted from a table
* Agent Lookup is returned and matches the currently stored values per the requirement. 
* Response should be returned under 2 seconds
* Only logged in users with an API role can access this information

title: As a BOC User, I want to change eligible year on player
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://z3s0a8.axshare.com/#p=scouting___draft

AC:
 - BOC User should be able to change a domestic amateur player's eligible year from the player profile
 - If the year is moved forward, gap years should be created in the player's Rule 4 Draft History widget in their profile
 - If the year is moved backwards, any gap years that exist should be removed from the Rule 4 Draft History widget in their profile

title: As a BOC User, I want to Ignore a Match on the Domestic Amateur Widget
custom_steps:
AC:
 - On the Domestic Amateur Player widget, selecting two players who are potential matches to each other (i.e. parent row and row expansion) will activate the Ignore button
 - Selecting players who are not potential matches will not activate the Ignore button
 - Clicking the Ignore button will prompt the user to confirm they wish to Ignore the match
**Title:** Warning
**Body:** Are you sure you want to ignore this match?
**Hint:** This is a permanent action that cannot be undone.
**Buttons:** Yes, No
  -- If they click 'Yes', the widget will reload and the player will no longer appear as a potential match
  -- If they click 'No', the modal will be dismissed

title: As a BOC User, I want to be prevented from moving an eligible year to a previous year
custom_steps:
AC:
 - If user attempts to update a player's eligible year to a draft year where the draft has already been completed, they will receive a blocking message:
**BODY:**  "You may not update a player's eligible year to a draft year that has already been completed."
**Buttons:** Back
 - Clicking Back or the X will close the message

title: As a User I want the old Domestic Amateur searches to be removed and the new ones to have 'New' removed from their names
custom_steps:
Remove the old 'Domestic Amateur' quick and advanced searches.

Rename the 'New Domestic Amateur' quick and advanced searches to 'Domestic Amateur'

title: As a BOC User, I want to be prevented from editing a drafted player's eligible year prior to the signing deadline
custom_steps:
AC:
 - If user attempts to update a recently drafted player's eligible year prior to the Signing Deadline, they will receive a blocking message:
**BODY:**  "You may not update this player's eligible year until the Signing Deadline has passed."
**Buttons:** Back
 - Clicking Back or the X will close the message

title: As a User, I want the Domestic Amateur option removed from the Left Nav
custom_steps:
AC:
 - There will no longer be a "Domestic Amateur" Left Nav link
 - Users will be able to access Create New Player and Rule 4 related links under the "Rule 4" left nav link

title: As a User, I want the Passed Over Player screen to link to DPL
custom_steps:
Wire:
https://z3s0a8.axshare.com/#p=amateur_player

AC:
 - The text "Draft Prospect Link (DPL)" on the Create New Player screen should be made into a hyperlink that connects to: http://prospectlink.mlb.com/

title: As a User, I want requirements for the new Towers Watson feed from ebis
As a user, I want Towers Watson to be a batch option on the batch admin screen
As a user, I want the towers Watson batch to generate results based on the personnel SQL
As a user, I want the towers Watson batch to generate results based on the employment SQL
As a user, I want to download the personnel file from the towers Watson batch results
As a user, I want to download the employment file from the towers Watson batch results
As a BOC user I want to be able to load the users for an Org
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=user_accounts_-_boc

Acceptance Criteria: 
* The "User" dropdown will contain all of the user ids associated with the selected Org.  
* BOC users are able to pick a specific Org and leave "User" set to "All" and click "View". 
* Clicking "View" will load the specified Org's user ids per the wireframe.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to load the users by Role
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=user_accounts_-_boc

Acceptance Criteria: 
* BOC users are able to pick a specific Role and leave "User" set to "All" and click "View". 
* Clicking "View" will load the specified Org's user ids that have been assigned the selected role per the wireframe.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to view the new User Accounts utility
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=user_accounts_-_boc

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Under "Utilities" there is a User Accounts tab.
* Launching this tab will display the utility per the wireframe. 
* Browser tab text says "User Accounts"
* The options available under ORG will be BOC, Unassigned and the 30 Clubs.
* The "User" dropdown default will be "All" 
* When User is set to All there is also a "Role" dropdown available. 
* The Role dropdown should default to All. 
* When User is set to a value other than "All" the Role dropdown should no longer be available. 
* There is a "View" button available on the screen.

title: As a Club user I want to view the new User Accounts utility
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=user_accounts_-_club

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Under "Utilities" there is a User Accounts tab.
* Launching this tab will display the utility per the wireframe. 
* There will be no Org dropdown for Club users, or it will default to their own Club and not be editable (whichever is easier).
* The "User" dropdown default will be "All" 
* When User is set to All there is also a "Feature" dropdown available. 
* The feature dropdown contains a list of all available system features. 
* When User is set to a value other than "All" the Feature dropdown should no longer be available. 
* When an individual feature is selected there is also a "Role" dropdown available. 
* The Role dropdown should default to All. 
* The Role dropdown should have a list of available Roles for the selected feature. 
* When Feature is set to "All" the Role dropdown should no longer be available. 
* There is a "View" button available on the screen.

title: New BOC User Account utility - Permissions
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* A new LDAP is created to view the new BOC User Account utility.
* A new LDAP is created to edit the new BOC User Account utility.
* BOC Users who have either LDAP see the "Utilities" Left Navigation menu. 
* Users who have either LDAP see the "User Accounts" tab under the Utilities Left Navigation menu and see the Tab on the Utilities dashboard. Users without either permission do not see this. 
* Clicking on "User Accounts" will load the utility per previously delivered stories.
* If the user does NOT have edit permissions, they do not see an Edit button when viewing individual users.
* If the user does NOT have edit permissions, they do not see the "update selected users" portion of the screen. 
* If the user does have edit permissions, they are able to edit appropriately. 
* As part of delivering this story - please add the Editor permission to test_boc_approver account, and the viewer permission to the test_boc_viewer account.

title: New Club User Account utility - Permissions
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* A new LDAP is created to view the new Club User Account utility.
* A new LDAP is created to edit the new Club User Account utility.
* Club Users who have either LDAP see the "Utilities" Left Navigation menu. 
* Users who have either LDAP see the "User Accounts" tab under the Utilities Left Navigation menu and see the Tab on the Utilities dashboard. Users without either permission do not see this. 
* Clicking on "User Accounts" will load the utility per previously delivered stories.
* If the user does NOT have edit permissions, they do not see an Edit button when viewing individual users.
* If the user does have edit permissions, they are able to edit appropriately. 
* As part of delivering this story - the Viewer permission should be added to a newly created ebis-system-club-viewer-role.
* As part of delivering this story - the Editor permission should be added to the existing ebis-system-club-admin-role.

title: New IT User Account utility - Permissions
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* A new LDAP is created to view the new IT User Account utility.
* A new LDAP is created to edit the new IT User Account utility.
* Users who have either LDAP see the "Utilities" Left Navigation menu. 
* Users who have either LDAP see the "Roles & Permissions" tab under the Utilities Left Navigation menu and see the Tab on the Utilities dashboard. Users without either permission do not see this. 
* Clicking on "Roles & Permissions" will load the utility per previously delivered stories.
* If the user does NOT have edit permissions, they do not see any of the action buttons when viewing the screen. (Edit, Create New, Sync, etc.) 
* If the user does have edit permissions, they are able to edit appropriately. 
* As part of delivering this story - the Viewer permission should be added to a newly created ebis-system-permissions-boc-viewer-role.
* As part of delivering this story - the Editor permission should be added to the existing ebis-system-permissions-boc-admin-role.

title: As a Club user I want to be able to load the users for my Org
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=user_accounts_-_club

Acceptance Criteria: 
* The "User" dropdown will contain all of the user ids associated with the viewing Org.  
* Club users are able to leave "User" set to "All" and click "View". 
* Clicking "View" will load the specified Org's user ids per the wireframe. 
* For each user the system will show a comma separated list of the users' roles, using the English Language description of the role (Ex: MJ Transactions Club Admin).

title: As a BOC user I want to add a new individual LDAP to a user account
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=user_accounts_-_boc

Acceptance Criteria:
* In edit mode there is an "Add Individual Permission" dropdown. 
* This dropdown has every NON role permission available in the system in a searchable dropdown.
* Selecting a permission will add the individual permission to the "Individual Permissions" section of the utility. 
* The permission is saved to the user when the form is saved.

title: As a Club user I want to be able to load only users for my Org that have certain Roles
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=user_accounts_-_club

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When the "User" dropdown is set to "All" and and Feature and/or Role selections have been applied, clicking "View" will load the relevant user ids per the wireframe.

title: As a Club user I want to load the permissions for an individual user
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=user_accounts_-_club

Acceptance Criteria: 
* The "User" dropdown will contain all of the user ids associated with the selected Org. 
* Club users are able to pick a specific user id and click "View". 
* Clicking "View" will load the specified user id per the wireframe. 
* Each available feature will display with the selected roles for the user under the Features section of the utility. The roles will display as the user friendly description of each role ex: MJ Transactions Club Admin. 
* Any permissions the user has that have been added outside of a role are displayed in the "Individual Permissions" section.

title: As a Club user I want to edit the roles for an individual user
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=user_accounts_-_club

Acceptance Criteria: 
* There is an Edit button available on the Club version of the screen.
* Clicking "Edit" will load the utility in edit mode per the wireframe. 
* There will be a "Save" button and a "Cancel" button available in edit mode.
* Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to cancel all changes. If the user confirms, the utility is reloaded in View mode with no changes made to the relevant user account. If the user does not confirm, they are returned to the utility in edit mode with their current edits still available. 
* The user will be able to set each Feature to "None" or to one of the Roles associated with the feature. 
* The "Individual Permissions" section of the screen is entirely uneditable for Club users. 
* Clicking "Save" will update the relevant user account by removing any roles and associated permissions that have been removed, and adding any roles and associated permissions that have been added.

title: As a Club user I want to edit the role assigned to a user for a specific feature
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=user_accounts_-_club

Acceptance Criteria: 
* If a Club user changes a feature's role selection for an existing user, the system should remove the previously selected Role and its associated permissions from the user account, and subsequently add the newly selected Role and its associated permissions (Ex: Changing a MJC Admin to a MJC Viewer). 
* Ensure that the remove is done FIRST so that the overlapping roles are not wiped clean accidentally.
*Note that typically the reporting roles are overlapping so they would be a good thing to check out to ensure this works properly*

title: As an IT User I want to see the LDAP Mapping utility
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=roles___permissions

Acceptance Criteria:
* Under "Utilities" there is a Roles & Permissions tab.
* Launching this tab will display the utility per the wireframe. 
* The "Roles" portion of the utility will display all of the current roles available for ebis. (ex: ebis-mjc-club-viewer-role)
* Each Role will have an expansion section that will contain all of the indvidual groups that are mapped to that role.
* The user will also be able to view the Feature related to the role, where applicable, as well as the English Language description of the role. 
* The "Unmapped Permissions" portion of the utility will display any individual group that is not currently found to be associated with any Role.

title: As a BOC user I want to load the permissions for an individual user
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=user_accounts_-_boc

Acceptance Criteria: 
* The "User" dropdown will contain all of the user ids associated with the selected Org. 
* BOC users are able to pick a specific user id and click "View". 
* Clicking "View" will load the specified user id per the wireframe.

title: As a BOC user I want to edit the permissions for an individual user
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=user_accounts_-_boc

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Once a user id has been loaded in the utility, there is an "Edit" button on the page. 
* Clicking "Edit" will place the page in edit mode, replacing the Edit button with a Save button and a Cancel button. 
* Clicking the Cancel button will ask the user to confirm that they are OK losing changes, and if the user confirms, reload the page in view mode with no changes made to the selected user id. 
* While in Edit mode, there is a dropdown that the user can use to select a new Role to add to the userid being edited. 
* Selecting a Role from the dropdown will add the Role to the screen. 
* In edit mode the user will also see trash cans associated with each Role the user has, and be able to remove the user from any of its current roles using the trash cans. 
* No changes are maintained until the user clicks "Save". 
* Clicking "Save" reloads the page in View mode, with the changes made to the user id's account maintained. 
* If a role has been added more than once to the same userID, do not add it for a second time (control duplicate roles this way).

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to bulk add a role to users within an Org
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=updated_selected_users

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a BOC user is viewing the User Accounts utility and there is a list of users loaded, there is a column of checkboxes allowing the user to check off one or more of the users displayed.
* Once at least one user has been checked, the "Add Roles to  Selected" dropdown enables. It is disabled until at least one is checked.
* The dropdown contains a searchable list of each Role available in the system, using the "User Friendly" role description. 
* Once at least one role has been selected, the "Add Roles" button becomes enabled. 
* Clicking "Add Roles" will add the selected roles to the selected user ids, along with all of the underlying permissions associated with the selected roles. 
* A blue success message displays "X Accounts updated successfully", with X being replaced with the number of user ids updated.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to export the detailed permissions for all of the users within an Org
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=user_accounts_-_boc

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a BOC user is viewing the User Accounts utility and there is a list of users loaded, there is an Export button available.
* Clicking "Export" will download an Excel spreadsheet of all of the user ids displayed, along with their Roles and their detailed permissions. 
*Example in comments*

title: As a Club user I want to be able to export the detailed permissions for all of the users within my Org
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=user_accounts_-_club

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a Club user is viewing the User Accounts utility and there is a list of users loaded, there is an Export button available.
* Clicking "Export" will download an Excel spreadsheet of all of the user ids displayed, along with their Roles and their detailed permissions. 
*Example in comments*

title: As an IT user I want to be able to create a new LDAP
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=roles___permissions
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=create_new_permission

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When viewing the IT User Accounts utility, there is a Create New Permission button visible in edit or view mode.
* Clicking the Create New Permission button will launch the create new permission modal per the wireframe.
* On the modal there is a text field where the user can enter the new permission.
* The user can add multiple rows by clicking the "Add Row" button. 
* Once more than one row exists, each row has a trash can icon available, with clicking the trash can icon removing the relevant row. 
* If only one row is present, there is no trash can icon. 
* Once text is entered in the modal for each added row, the "Save" button becomes available. 
* Clicking "Save" will add the selected permissions to the database and the corresponding environment's LDAP. 
* Clicking "Cancel" will close the modal with no permissions being added.
* Newly added permissions will appear in the "Unmapped Permissions" portion of the utility and be available to add to existing roles.

title: As an IT User I want to be able to create a new role
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=roles___permissions
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=create_new_role

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When viewing the IT User Accounts utility, there is a Create New Role button visible in edit or view mode.
* Clicking the Create New Role button will launch the create new role modal per the wireframe.
* On the modal there is a text field where the user can enter the new role (ex: ebis-mj-transactions-boc-admin-role).
* The user will have the ability to indicate whether this is a Club only role, to enter the user facing description and select the relevant feature.
* The user can also select one or more existing permissions to map to the new role by using a searchable dropdown of available non-role permissions.
* The user can add multiple rows of permissions by clicking the "Add Row" button. 
* Once more than one row exists, each row has a trash can icon available, with clicking the trash can icon removing the relevant row. 
* If only one row is present, there is no trash can icon. 
* Once all required fields are completed in the modal for each added row, the "Save" button becomes available. 
* Clicking "Save" will add the new Role to the database and the corresponding environment's LDAP and map the role as described in the modal. A blue successful save notification will display.  
* The new role will now appear in the utility. 
* Clicking "Cancel" will close the modal with no role being added.
*Note that this works independently of the form's edit/save capabilities, even if the form is in edit mode at the time the button is clicked*

title: As an IT User I want to be able to create a new role from a template
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=roles___permissions
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=create_new_role_from_template

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When viewing the IT User Accounts utility, there is a Create New Role from Template button visible in edit or view mode.
* Clicking the Create New Role from Template button will launch the create new role from template modal per the wireframe.
* On the modal the user can select an existing role to re-create. 
* Once they select a role, the modal will update to display all of the permissions available for the selected role, allowing the user to add and remove additional permissions. 
* On the modal there is a text field where the user can enter the new role (ex: ebis-mj-transactions-boc-admin-role).
* The user will have the ability to indicate whether this is a Club only role, to enter the user facing description and select the relevant feature.
* The user can also select one or more existing permissions to map to the new role by using a searchable dropdown of available non-role permissions.
* The user can add multiple rows of permissions by clicking the "Add Row" button. 
* Once more than one row exists, each row has a trash can icon available, with clicking the trash can icon removing the relevant row. 
* If only one row is present, there is no trash can icon. 
* Once all required fields are completed in the modal for each added row, the "Save" button becomes available. 
* Clicking "Save" will add the new Role to the database and the corresponding environment's LDAP and map the role as described in the modal. A blue successful save notification will display.  
* The new role will now appear in the utility. 
* Clicking "Cancel" will close the modal with no role being added.
*Note that this works independently of the form's edit/save capabilities, even if the form is in edit mode at the time the button is clicked*

title: As an IT User I want to be able to delete an existing role or permission
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=roles___permissions

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When viewing the IT User Accounts utility, there is an Edit button.
* Clicking edit will place the form in edit mode. 
* While in edit mode there is a trash can button next to each Role, and also a trash can icon next to each individual permission under "Unmapped Permissions".
* Clicking the trash can icon will remove the Role or individual permission from the utility.
* Clicking "Save" will permanently delete the role LDAP or the unmapped permission from LDAP. If a role is being deleted, the underlying permissions are not touched, just the role is deleted and removed from BOC and Club utilities. 

*Note that to delete an individual permission they must be removed from all relevant roles first so that they appear in the "Unmapped Permission" section.

title: As an IT User I want to be able to sync users from the IT utility
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=roles___permissions

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When viewing the IT User Accounts utility, there is a Sync button.
* Clicking Sync will performa the following actions: 
 - Check that all of the relevant LDAP permissions exist in the database and the LDAP database for the relevant environment. If not, create the required LDAPs. 
 - Find any newly mapped permissions added since the last sync and update all of the user accounts that have the relevant role to have the newly added permissions.

title: As a user I want to be able to add "extra" cash line items to As Of Payroll reports
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* Users are able to specify one-off line items to be added to the "Cash" portion of the CBT Payrolls report (would need to be a stored as of date - not one run on the fly). 
* The specified line item prints on the specified CBT Payroll report(s). 

From Cameron: 
One more note on the Longoria cash. Would it be possible, as a one-time fix, to include an additional $2,000,000 cash line item for the Longoria cash transaction on CBT payrolls only (debit to TB, credit to SF)? This amount was used to offset Longoriaâ€™s earned assignment bonus and is part of an unusual situation where cash is not treated on an AAV basis for CBT. No worries if you guys arenâ€™t able to make this ad hoc adjustment, but I figured I would ask.

Idea from Scott: 
we could give them a way to get "extra" cash line items onto the regular payroll reports
we could create a simple table where we would manually add entries
and that table would be included in the query for that section of the report

title: As a User, I want to run the DL Summary Report based on Service Day / Year
custom_steps:
Business Value:
This would allow users to obtain the number of DL days used, and the number of DL placements made, as of any specific day of the championship season.

Reqs:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/DL+Summary+-+Report+Prompts

AC:
 - When running the Disabled List Summary Report, the prompt screen will display Date Type dropdown prompt
 - There will be a "Service Day" Option in the Date Type dropdown
 - Selecting Service Day will hide the From and To date fields
 - Selecting Service Day will display two new fields:
  - Service Day (Defaults to 1)
  - Service Year (Defaults to current year)
 - The specified Service Day will effectively become the end date of a date range, with January 1st being the start date
 - Running the report for Service Day will return the list of players who were placed on the Disabled List through the service day specified of the service year specified.

For example:  If the user enters Service Day: 135 and Service Year: 2017,  the report will return all DL Placements from the beginning of the year through Day 135 of 2017.

title: As a user, I want the Rule 4 pre draft batch 'reset' mode to only reset the draft if it was run in mock mode
custom_steps:
The rule 4 pre draft batch should only reset the draft if it is currently being run in mock mode.  If the draft is run in 'live' mode it can only be reset using the testing only reset batch.

If the batch is run in reset mode and the draft was started in live mode, the user should receive an error message

title: As a BOC User, I want to see an 'Are You Sure?' message when starting the draft in Mock Mode
custom_steps:
AC:
 - When the User clicks "Start Mock Draft" on the Draft Day screen, they will be prompted to confirm they wish to start the draft in Mock Mode
  **Text:** "You are about to start the draft in **Mock Mode**.  Do you wish to continue?"
  **Buttons** Yes, No
 - Clicking Yes will launch the draft in Mock Mode
 - Clicking No will dismiss the modal and return the user to the Draft Day screen

title: As a BOC User, I want to see an 'Are You Sure?' message when starting the real draft
custom_steps:
AC:
 - When the User clicks "Start Draft" on the Draft Day screen, they will be prompted to confirm they wish to start the actual draft
  **Text:** "You are about to start the **[Current Draft Year] Rule 4 Draft**.  Do you wish to continue?"
  **Buttons** Yes, No
 - Clicking Yes will launch the draft
 - Clicking No will dismiss the modal and return the user to the Draft Day screen

title: As a User, I want EBIS to send out a SLACK notification if a Club is disconnected from the draft
custom_steps:
AC:
 - If a club is disconnected from the draft for X amount of time, send a notification to the Draft slack room
 - If a a club is disconnected from the draft within X picks of their pick, send a notification to the Draft slack room
 - These settings should be easily configurable
 - They should also allow for different settings based on draft round (i.e. 5 min rounds 1-3, 2 min rounds 10-40)

#best-ebis-r4-support Slack Channel

title: As a user I want to run the Rule 5 Pre-Draft batch
custom_steps:
Batch Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Rule+5+Pre-Draft+Batch

Acceptance Criteria:
* "Rule 5 Pre-Draft" is a batch option under the "Rule 5" section on the batch screen.
* Clicking "Rule 5 Pre-Draft" opens the batch in the batch screen. 
* The batch parameters display per the batch requirements. 
* A "Run" button is available. 
* Clicking "Run" will run the batch according to the selected parameters. 
* Running the batch will find all of the players that are currently eligible for the Rule 5 Draft and are NOT currently on a 40 Man Roster and populate them on the Selectable Players tab of the Rule 5 Draft. 
* Running the batch will populate the Reserve Lists tab of the Rule 5 Draft with the current Under Control count for each MJ and AAA Club UNLESS someone has manually saved the Reserve List counts for the current year. 
* Batch run information should display in the batch history widget.

title: As a user if the draft state is loading I don't want the screen to return until it finished
custom_steps: When the batch is running all of the draft screens should continue to show a spinner until the batch finishes.

title: As a user I want to see the Last Updated information on the Selectable Players screen
custom_steps:
Wire:
https://aceshn.axshare.com/#p=selectable_players_-_pre_draft

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When loading the Selectable Players screen, there is a "Last Updated" time and datestamp per the wireframe.
* This timestamp reflects the last time the selectable players population was refreshed via the Rule 5 Pre Draft batch.
* There is also a tool tip or something that states "For the most up to date list, run the Potential Rule 5 Selectable Report". This is ONLY displayed when the draft is not yet in progress. When the draft is in progress or has completed, this is not displayed.

title: As a user I want to see the Last Updated information on the Reserve Lists screen
custom_steps:
Wire:
https://aceshn.axshare.com/#p=reserve_lists_-_pre_draft

Acceptance Criteria:
* When loading the Reserve Lists screen, there is a "Last Updated" time and datestamp per the wireframe.
* This timestamp reflects the last time the reserve counts were stored, whether that was manually or by the batch. 
* The note at the top of the page should be updated to read "The Reserve Counts have yet to be saved. These are the reserve counts for each club as of the last updated timestamp." This note continues to only display up until the Reserve Counts are manually saved or the draft starts.

title: As a User I want entering a voluntary retired transaction on an optioned player to set both MJ and MN roster status to voluntary retired
custom_steps:
When approving a voluntary retired transaction for an optioned player, the player's MJ roster status should be set to voluntary retired in addition to their MN status.  

The player should then show as just voluntary retired and NOT optioned/voluntary retired.

story created as a result of: https://jira.boc.mlb.com:8443/browse/EBISII-15463

title: As a Club User, I want to Reinstate a Player From the Inactive List (Temporary Inactive List for All-Star Games - No Minimum amount of days) Less Than 3 Days after Placement
custom_steps:
Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/19.+Reinstate+from+Inactive+List

Messages:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/IL+-+Messages

Rule 19.18.1:
 A Minor League player on the Temporary Inactive List with a Reason for Placement of "Inactive List (Temporary Inactive List for All-Star Games - No Minimum amount of days)" may be reinstated with no minimum day requirement.

AC:
 - If a minor league player on the temporary inactive list and his reason for placement is "Inactive List (Temporary Inactive List for All-Star Games - No Minimum amount of days)", he may be reinstated, with no minimum day requirements
 - Message #38 will not fire when these players are reinstated less than 3 days after placement on the IL

title: As a User, if a DFA'd player has both TRD and OUT Waivers In Effect, I want that to be indicated on the Current DFA Players widget
custom_steps:
Wire:
https://b6mbog.axshare.com/#p=dfa_players

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Current+DFA+Players+widget

AC:
 - If a player is Designated for Assignment and has both TRD and OUT Waivers currently in effect, the "Waivers in Effect" column of the Current DFA Players widget will display both TRD and OUT

title: As a User, I want to View clubs who have received more than $800k in the past 6 months
custom_steps:
Wire:
https://t4lvuq.axshare.com/#p=trade_contract_info

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Trade+Contract+Info+widget

Cash Considerations Report Details:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/EBIS4-TXT-5844+Report+Details

AC:
 - In the header of the widget, there will be a list of "Clubs who received +800k in the last 6 months", as depicted in the wire
 - This list will use same logic as the first page of the Cash Considerations Report
 - This list of clubs will match the list of clubs displayed on the Cash Summary tab of the Cash Considerations report

title: Updated Permissions for Player Tracking Tab
custom_steps:
On the Transactions dashboard, there is a Player Tracking tab.

 - If a user has access to the widgets on that tab, the tab should be available to them.
 - If a user doesn't have access to any widgets on that tab, they should not see the tab.

title: As a User I want the Highmark Insurance batch to send an add for minor league players who have their MJ flag unset on opening day
custom_steps:
On opening day any players who were Mn Outrighted over the course of the prior season up until the start date of the new season will have their MJ flag shut off by the mj insurance batch.  When this happens the Highmark batch should detect the change and send an 'add' insurance record for the player.

In addition to the add being sent, it should set the players MN insurance flag.

title: Update to MLBPA Rosters Feed
custom_steps:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Feed+Requirements+-+Rosters+for+MLPA

AC:
 - The following fields will be added to the MLPA Rosters API:
- Agency from most recent Major League UPC
- Agent from most recent Major League UPC
- Addresses (all types)
- Phone numbers (all types)
- Email Addresses (all types)

title: As a user I want a better visual indication of when I've reached a drop area for drag and drop
custom_steps:
AC:
(*This is specifically for the pick queue on the draft day screen*)
- When a drag and drop row is "picked up"  drag and drop areas should display with a dashed line around them.  The dashed line should be (#999999)
- When a drag and drop row is over an area it can be dropped the dashed outline should change to a solid line.  The solid line color should be (#0099ff, the same color as the attached files drag and drop outline)

title: Sometimes Forms Don't Scroll Proper When New Items Added
custom_steps:
When user clicks edit then "Add Player" on the Tender utility it should automatically scroll all the way down to the newly created row. Currently it starts to scroll but gets hung up and doesn't scroll all the way down.  This may happen on other forms as well.  Should make sure any fix for this is system wide.

Came from JIRA https://jira.boc.mlb.com:8443/browse/EBISII-13830

title: Create a proper 404 page
custom_steps: For invalid URLs, the current behavior is that the app loads the Rosters page with blank content.   Since this is not particularly helpful for the user, we should create a view for 404 pages.  We can then tag this page in Omniture as a error page, which may give us insight into broken links/paths.
